Speaker: young man
Dialogue: Please-please stop. D-don't.

Speaker: young man
Dialogue: SARAH!    RUN!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Come on, hit me.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Chill...I gotta find -- alright.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You got one?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: "Warning Shots", Thievery Corporation.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Come on.   Next one.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: "Bullets" by the Editors.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: You loaded these songs. You don't need to be so impressed with yourself.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I know I don't have to be.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I haven't even heard of half these bands.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It's called good music. You should try to familiarize yourself with it, instead of listening to the crap you do.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I listen to crap?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Hurts me to be the one to tell you.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I'm sure it does.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You gotta be more like me, baby. Think new, fresh, cutting edge. I'm looking for the next Beatles, U2 or Radiohead.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: So, where does this band fall into that group?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Fresh, new or cutting edge?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: How'd that get on there?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: You loaded the songs.   You tell me?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Must be a mistake.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Says here you've listened to it 86 times.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Is this true? Have you always wanted to be a cowboy?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: You also got "Men Without Hats" greatest hits? I didn't know they qualified for a greatest hits album. Can you break me off a little "Safety Dance"?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Okay, give me that.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Good morning.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Now what can I do you two for?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Well...ah...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: First time here and you're not quite sure where to begin.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Something like that.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Precisely like that.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Get you started with one of these.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: How long you folks hiking for?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Two days.    Heading out early Sunday.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Well, if you move at a decent clip, you could hit the summit by midday tomorrow. Should still give you time to take it all in and make it down.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Any particular path?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You folks experienced hikers?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We've done some ah--

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: No. Nothing like this.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: For first-timers, I recommend either Willow Creek Bridge or Donner Trail.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Donner Trail? As in "The Donner Party?"

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm not sure of the name's origin. They're the two paths we regularly patrol. Something happens and you're on one of the other trails, it might be awhile before we find you.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Where do we camp?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Unless it says not to, you can set up where you like. Just make sure when you turn in that you extinguish your fire. Oh, and this here's bear country. They're not animals to fool with. You see one, you head the other way, especially if he's feeding. If the bear thinks you're getting in the way of his food, that's all she wrote.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Great.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You got yourself a first aid kit?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Nurse Betty here's my first aid kit.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Don't mind him. I'm a nurse.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Good for you. The question was, do you have a first aid kit?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Yes, we have a first aid kit.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Great, see how easy that was.  It's off-season, park's pretty quiet. Even more than usual. You may run into a few locals, but--

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: People live up here?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We have a few generations of families that have called these mountains home. Most of `em are friendly. Respect their land and they'll respect you.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Base is just outside, to the left. At about two miles up there'll be a junction where you can pick your path.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You getting anything?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'll lock them in the car.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I'll take mine.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Just to annoy you.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Seriously...

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: In an emergency, I'd rather have a phone that may not work up there, than not have a phone that may work up there.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Okay, we all set?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Yup.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Let's do this.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Hey, Einstein. What do you think, leave the tent or maybe take it with us?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I was just seeing if you were paying attention.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: It could be fun.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Not a chance. High School reunions serve only two purposes... to try to

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: So what were you?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Me?   I was a stoner.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: So what does that mean?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: How the hell am I supposed to remember? I was high all the time.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Where'd you get that bandana?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: It's cute, right? I stopped by that Army-Navy store on Grover yesterday. Keeps the sweat out of your eyes.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: And when you were buying it, you didn't think that maybe...

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Oh...well...it was the last one...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: The last one?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: The entire Army-Navy store... sold out?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Completely. There was some sort of run on bandanas at the last minute.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Here... You big baby.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Fucking nasty.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Looks like it's a, or was, a fox. Come on.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: What do you think?    "Cannibal" Trail or the other one?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Guidebook says a couple of these other trails lead to some pretty sweet views.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: We're not Lewis and/or Clark. We're gonna stick to one of the ones the Ranger said.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We're just going over our options here.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Well, take it from me, any way you choose, you can't go wrong.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: The Ranger at base suggested Donner Trail or...

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: ...Willow Creek Bridge. I think Sam only knows those two trails. Well. Between those, I'd pick Donner Trail. Willow Creek will shoot you to the top, but there's not as much to see. Donner weaves through Peddler's Point, it's a better hike and prettier all around view.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: What do you think?

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: That's a pretty ring.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Not your traditional wedding ring, but it's all the same in the Lord's eyes. How long have you two been wed?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Oh... we're not married.    Not yet anyway.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: It's a ring my father gave me for graduation.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: I'm just an old fashioned silly-bird. I need to mind my own business.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: No, it's fine.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Which one of those trails got the best clearings?

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Clearings? Neither will give you much in the way of clearings. But, there's another path, this one here.  Timber Falls. Its got some beautiful vistas and one of the prettiest falls you'll ever see.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sounds perfect.  Yeah?

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Well, I'll leave you to it. Last thing you need is me fussing'round you, taking you from your private time.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: I'm just gonna say it and go, but if you two were to marry... I bet the Lord would bless you with a happy, healthy and handsome child. Good luck and God bless you both.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I suddenly feel the need for confession.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Not yet? Love taking your shots, don't ya?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: When I see an opening.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: That path she was talking about winds through these falls. What do you think?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I think... if you get eaten by a bear and there isn't a Ranger around, I'm not carrying what's left of you down this mountain.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: And they say romance is dead.  Timber Falls it is.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Who's Lewis and/or Clark?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: You really were stoned through high school.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You're going to lose that out here.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: It's fine. I never take it off. Not since you gave it to me. Betcha don't remember...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I remember every moment with you.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I've got you so whipped.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: OUCH!   FUCK!

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: My hand... Something stuck it.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: It's okay. It's not too deep.      Let me get the first aid kit.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Fuck.   That stung.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Gotta clean the wound, baby.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You know me and blood... we don't do so well.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I know.  All done.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Not bad, Nightingale.     Not bad at all.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Did you hear something?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It's probably the deer.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: The deer went in the other direction.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Maybe it's someone, or something, stalking us.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Quit it.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Something inhuman watching our every move.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I said, knock it off.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Something coming for you, Sheryl.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Just when I think there's hope for you.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: You're an asshole.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: This is a joke. You're not really mad, are you? Sheryl...?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm sorry!  Unbelievable.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sheryl!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sheryl, wait up!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sheryl?! This isn't funny.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sheryl?!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sheryl!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You bitch.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Doesn't feel good to be teased, does it?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Truce?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Truce.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Don't disappear on me again.

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Looks like we got ourselves a little party.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We were just moving our way up the mountain.

Speaker: lonnie
Dialogue: You were moving your way'round more than just that.

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Like a peach.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You folks best be careful about what you do up here... Never know who's watching.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Appreciate the advice...I think we learned our lesson.

Speaker: lonnie
Dialogue: You city folk, ain't ya? Up from Charleston roughing it, seeing how the "other" half lives?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No, we're from Virginia, just up for a weekend trip. And, uh... you folks live up here?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: It's easy to spot the city folk. It's like they're trying to be friendly, when really they don't want to be.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I think you just startled us is all.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We'll just be on our way.  May I have those?

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Finders keepers.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Darryl.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Where you runnin' off to?

Speaker: lonnie
Dialogue: Yeah, we just getting acquainted and shit.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: We just want to get a little further along before the sun sets.

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Plenty of time'fore that.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Look. We don't want any trouble.   We just want to be on our way...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: And why do you suppose we mean to make trouble?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You folks enjoy the spirits?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Excuse me?     The what?

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Spirits.

Speaker: lonnie
Dialogue: Booze!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sure.    Yeah.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Why don't you try a taste of this?

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Betcha never tasted nuthin'like that?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Fifty bucks.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'll sell you the jar for fifty bucks.

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Or maybe we could do us a little trade.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Let me get my wallet.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Fifty bucks sounds like a bargain.  Pay the man.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Pleasure doing business with ya.     Take care now.

Speaker: lonnie
Dialogue: Should you tire of your present company... just holla and I'll come running with bells on darling.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: You brought a gun?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Why did you bring a gun?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Same reason you brought your cellphone. Better to have it and not need it. To protect us.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Lotta good it just did.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sheryl? I'm sorry.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: We should have stuck to one of the patrolled paths.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Fuck.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You alright?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Do you know how many times I've had someone die on me? How many children? I stopped keeping count.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I thought... I wasn't thinking.       What do you want me to do?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Get rid of the gun.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What... now? Out here?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I can't just leave it here in the woods, some kid could find it.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Then get rid of the bullets now and when we get home, you get rid of the gun.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Please.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Was that all of them?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Oh. Didn't mean to startle you folks. Just clearing some of the brush off

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: It's fine. We were led to believe this trail wasn't regularly patrolled.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: It's not, but... It's one of my favorite spots, so I often find an excuse to swing by.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: It's gorgeous.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Yup. There are a couple more falls in the park, but none quite so... inviting as this one. Now don't take my word for it, you can see for yourself... How long's your stay?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Just til Sunday.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Yeah, no. The other falls are clear on the other side. It would take you a couple nights just to get there.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Maybe next time.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: This is a quickie trip. Just getting out of the city for a couple days.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: The city, huh. Which? If it's Charleston, I wouldn't blame ya. Whole place smells like feet. I gotta haul myself all the way down to the hospital there for my yearly because the darn HMO's rules and regulations won't let me visit the local Doc. Not my cup of tea at all, but if you like it there, then...

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: No, we're not from Charleston.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: But apparently we look like we are.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: We live in Alexandria.   It's just outside of D.C.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Oh. I've been there, few years back. Now that city I like. Lotta beautiful churches if I recall correctly. Which congregation do y'all belong to?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Um... Not sure. Sheryl keeps track of all that for us. Sheryl?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Uh... We're between congregations at the moment.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Well... I should get back to work. Sun'll be down soon and that path ain't gettin'clear on its own.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Excuse me... Sir?

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: The name's Clyde.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Clyde, would you recommend a nice spot nearby to make camp for the night?

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Be happy too... Let's see... Oh, I got it. "Five Corners" will be perfect. It's just a bit up the ways here, near the Lake. It's five large rocks which sit in a clearing with a view of the whole park. The rocks retain the heat from the day, so if you set up camp between them you won't be so cold.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Sounds perfect.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Just doing my job. You have fun and be careful. Good evening.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: This is incredible.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Ranger said there's a lake near by.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: The lake.    I'd kill to rinse off.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Whoa. Wait a sec. It'll be dark soon.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Where's your sense of adventure?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sher. Seriously.       Let's wait `til morning.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Do you know what you are doing?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I think its pretty obvious that I don't.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: That was... the worst dinner ever.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: You cooked.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm aware.  You know what would make this evening perfect? Moonshine. I got a whole jar of it. There's a sentence I never thought I'd say. "I have a jar of moonshine." Matter of fact, I've got enough to share with our entire congregation...

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: ... in Charleston.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Our home city, of course. But I should start with you... Would you like some moonshine?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Then what would you like?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I'd like to fuck you.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Not very Christian of you.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I'm more Old Testament.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What's that mean?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Not sure. But I think it's the nastier of the two books.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I was good. I mean, even better than usual.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: If you don't say so...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: ... if I don't say so myself, yeah. Top notch performance. What, you disagree?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Nah, it was good.   Do you think I had anything to do...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No.   All me.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: Fine.  I liked what the old woman said about us earlier.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What did she say?

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: That she thought we were married.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You are relentless.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I wouldn't be a proper girlfriend if I didn't nag every now and then.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I get it, but it makes me feel like the bad guy every time. Which makes me feel like shit.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I didn't mean that.       Where are you going?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Do out there, what you did in here.

Speaker: sheryl
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Put out the fire.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sheryl!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sheryl!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Fuck!  Sheryl!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sheryl!

Speaker: lonnie
Dialogue: What is it? Hear something?

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Nah.    It's nothing.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Where is she!?

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Whoa... take it easy.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Where is she?

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Who?    What the fuck you talking about?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What did you do to her?

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: I didn't fuckin' do nothing.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: WHERE IS SHE?!

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: I don't know!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You have Sheryl's towel...What the fuck did you do to her?!

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Foun' towel.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: I foun' the towel.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: You found it? That's you're fucking story, you inbred fuck?!  Stop fucking lying or I will kill you!

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Don' kill me...Please...I foun' it... Up...Up the paf back `dere...just a bit ago... fuckin'swear!

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Didn't think you had dat in you, city boy.  Shit... I just got dis shirt.

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: Damn shame you lost dat fine piece o'ass. Something dat sweet don't come'round every day. Even for pretty folk like you.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Shut the fuck up.

Speaker: darryl
Dialogue: You best hope you find her'fore I do. `cause I will enjoy tearing her ass apart.  Any luck, Brody's already beat me to it.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Sonofabitch!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: SHERYL!

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: HELP!?!?!

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Michael, can you hear me?    Michael...

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Ow!

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Look who's up.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Where am I?

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: You're in my home, Michael. You gave me quite a scare. I thought I lost you.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Lucky the snap didn't break the bone, just bruised it. I know that's of little comfort now, but trust me, it's a good thing. That dirty trap however's prime for spreading infection, need to finish cleaning out that wound and then I'll get some "evening primrose" in you. Same stuff the Indian Tribes used it back in the day to heal, well... just about everything. So's do I.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Try and relax.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Thank you.     For saving my life.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: You don't have to thank me. Up here, we take care of one another. That's the only way any of us survive.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Um...  I'm sorry, but I don't know your name.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Oh for the sake of sunshine... how rude a host am I? Name's Ida Foster.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Ida, I need some help.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: I'm moving as fast as I can, sweetie.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: No, not me. It's Sheryl. My girlfriend. You met her with me yesterday. Something's happened to her. She was gone this morning when I woke up. I looked everywhere and I couldn't find her. We need to call someone. A Ranger. Somebody. We need to find her right away. Do you have a phone?

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but I don't. Never really had use for one.  I do have a radio. We can call down to base if you'd like.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: After we take care of you.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm fine, Ida, please... if you could call now.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: You want to lose this leg? Cause that's what you're risking. Soon as we're done, I'll call. Okay?

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Bite down on this... I ain't gonna lie... Lotta pain about to hit you sweetheart.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: It's okay.     It's almost over.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: We'll get some of that primrose in you and you'll be good as new.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Ida? The radio. Please... Can you call down please?

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: I'll take care of it right now.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: He's looking for me.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Why's that?

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I think he had something to do with Sheryl going missing.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: I'll take care of it.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: I'm coming!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What took you so long?

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: What do you want, Brody?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'm looking for a man hiker.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: This "man hiker" alone or wit someone?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: He had a lady friend, but...    I'm just looking for him now.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Well, I ain't seen no one in days.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: What'd he do you for anyway?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: He busted Darryl's face in with a shotgun. Left him a mess of blood and teeth. Nearly killed him.  You spot anyone you don't know, you be sure to find me.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: He's gone. Brody and those boys are a pain in the backside. I'm sure that cousin of his had it coming.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: What did the Ranger say? Does he need to speak to me? When is he coming?

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Sorry, I wasn't able to reach anyone.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: God damnit!

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Please don't take the Lord's name in vain in this house.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: ida
Dialogue: Drink this.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Something's not right.
